intro: Humboltia conanthera, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Humboltia conanthera is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
